Class Arguments

  • java.lang.Object
    • Arguments

  • public final class Arguments
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains various useful methods related to checking the validity of arguments.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void ensureAtLeast(int n, int min)
      Throws an illegal argument exception if the given integer is not greater than or equal to the given minimum value.
      static void ensureAtMost(int n, int max)
      Throws an illegal argument exception if the given integer is not less than or equal to the given maximum value.
      static void ensureInRange(int n, int min, int max)
      Throws an illegal argument exception if the given integer is not between the given minimum and maximum values inclusive.
      static void ensureNonNegative(double d)
      Throws an illegal argument exception if the given real number is negative.
      static void ensureNonNegative(int n)
      Throws an illegal argument exception if the given integer is negative.
      static void ensureNotNull(java.lang.Object... a)
      Throws an illegal argument exception if any object in the given array is null.
      static void ensureNotNull(java.lang.Object o)
      Throws an illegal argument exception if the given object is null.
      static void ensureNotNullOrEmpty(java.lang.String s)
      Throws an illegal argument exception if the given string is null or the empty string.
      static void ensurePositive(int n)
      Throws an illegal argument exception if the given integer is not positive (> 0).

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • ensureNotNull

        public static void ensureNotNull(java.lang.Object o)
        Throws an illegal argument exception if the given object is null.

        o - object to be checked for nullness
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if o is null

      • ensureNotNull

        public static void ensureNotNull(java.lang.Object... a)
        Throws an illegal argument exception if any object in the given array is null.
        Parameters:
        a - array whose elements are to be checked for nullness (var-args)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any object in a is null

      • ensureNotNullOrEmpty

        public static void ensureNotNullOrEmpty(java.lang.String s)
        Throws an illegal argument exception if the given string is null or the empty string.
        Parameters:
        s - string to be checked for nullness/emptiness
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if s is null or ""

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n < min

      • ensureAtMost

        public static void ensureAtMost(int n,
                                int max)
        Throws an illegal argument exception if the given integer is not less than or equal to the given maximum value.
        Parameters:
        n - integer to be checked for its range
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n > max

      • ensureInRange

        public static void ensureInRange(int n,
                                 int min,
                                 int max)
        Throws an illegal argument exception if the given integer is not between the given minimum and maximum values inclusive.
        Parameters:
        n - integer to be checked for its range
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n < min or n > max

      • ensureNonNegative

        public static void ensureNonNegative(int n)
        Throws an illegal argument exception if the given integer is negative.
        Parameters:
        n - integer to be checked for its range
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n < 0

      • ensureNonNegative

        public static void ensureNonNegative(double d)
        Throws an illegal argument exception if the given real number is negative.
        Parameters:
        d - number to be checked for its range
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if d < 0.0

      • ensurePositive

        public static void ensurePositive(int n)
        Throws an illegal argument exception if the given integer is not positive (> 0).
        Parameters:
        n - integer to be checked for its range
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n <= 0
